page.title: 02Education in West Ashby.
page.content: In 1818 a Church Sunday School existed in which 12 children were taught. Â£300 was raised by subscription and an all age school for a 100 pupils was erected in 1874. Centenary celebrations were held and a cake was provided by W.I. ladies. Each child was presented with cake and a commemorative mug. A book was made by scholars recording the school past and present. In 1977 Jubilee celebrations included tea and sports; Jubilee mugs and Crown pieces were presented. A donation was sent to the Prince of Wales' appeal from funds raised. Sadly the school was closed in 1980 but it has recently been successfully and sympathetically converted into a private dwelling.
